Class HotWaterHeater

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.Component
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.HotWaterHeater
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class HotWaterHeater extends Component
The HotWaterHeater class represents a special type of component that can be added to or removed from a player's board in a game. The component has specific functionalities such as rotating in different directions and interacting with the player's board and state. It also controls its validity and can perform actions when visited.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • HotWaterHeater

      public HotWaterHeater()
      Default constructor for the HotWaterHeater class. This creates an instance of the HotWaterHeater component, which can be added to a player's game board. The HotWaterHeater has specific functionalities including rotation, interaction with the board and state, and the ability to validate its placement or perform actions as required.

  • Method Details

    • rotate

      public void rotate(Boolean direction)
      Rotates the engine direction of the component. The direction is updated according to the provided parameter, where true represents a clock-wise rotation and false represents a counter-clockwise rotation. The engine direction is maintained within 0 to 3 (inclusive), representing the four cardinal directions.
      Specified by:
      rotate in class Component
      Parameters:
      direction - a Boolean indicating the rotation direction. A value of true rotates the engine clock-wise, while a value of false rotates the engine counter-clockwise.

    • controlValidity

      public boolean controlValidity(PlayerBoard pb, int x, int y)
      Checks the validity of the hot water heater placement on the player board based on its current engine direction.
      Specified by:
      controlValidity in class Component
      Parameters:
      pb - the player board where the component is being validated
      x - the x-coordinate on the player board
      y - the y-coordinate on the player board
      Returns:
      true if the engine direction is equal to 3, false otherwise

    • accept

      public void accept(ComponentAction visitor, PlayerState state)
      Processes an interaction with a HotWaterHeater component by using the visitor pattern. This method allows a ComponentAction to perform specific operations on the HotWaterHeater while considering the current PlayerState.
      Overrides:
      accept in class Component
      Parameters:
      visitor - the ComponentAction that will interact with the HotWaterHeater component
      state - the current PlayerState, which may influence or validate the action being performed

    • insert

      public void insert(PlayerBoard playerBoard, int x, int y)
      Inserts a HotWaterHeater component onto the specified player's board at the given coordinates. Depending on the type of the HotWaterHeater, it may affect the engine power of the player's board. Additionally, the inserted component is registered within the player's hot water heaters list, and a tile update is triggered.
      Specified by:
      insert in class Component
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the player's game board where the component will be inserted
      x - the x-coordinate of the insertion location on the game board
      y - the y-coordinate of the insertion location on the game board

    • remove

      public void remove(PlayerBoard playerBoard)
      Removes the current HotWaterHeater component from the provided player's board. If the component type is 1, it decreases the player's engine power by 1. Removes this component from the player's collection of hot water heaters and sends an update for tile removal.
      Specified by:
      remove in class Component
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the player's board from which the HotWaterHeater is removed

    • getEnginePower

      public int getEnginePower()
      Retrieves the engine power associated with the current component.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the engine power. Returns 2 if the component type is 2; otherwise, returns 0.

    • clone

      public Component clone(PlayerBoard clonedPlayerBoard)
      Creates a deep copy of the current HotWaterHeater instance.
      Specified by:
      clone in class Component
      Parameters:
      clonedPlayerBoard - the PlayerBoard to associate with the cloned component
      Returns:
      the cloned HotWaterHeater instance
